sentence: Two of the leading Republican candidates in the Pennsylvania Senate race, David McCormick and Mehmet Oz, have hit each other over a perceived lack of loyalty to former President Donald Trump, who has yet to issue an endorsement in the race.
author: Theodore Bunker
title: Pennsylvania GOP Senate Candidates Fight for Trump's Endorsement

sentence: Trump asked Josh whether he should endorse David McCormick — whom he met with later on Wednesday at Mar-a-Lago — or Mehmet Oz in the Republican primary to replacing retiring Sen. Pat Toomey (R-Pa.).
title: The Post's interview with Donald Trump

sentence: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) on Sunday declined to weigh in on former President Trump’s endorsement of celebrity doctor Mehmet Oz in the crowded Pennsylvania Senate race just weeks before the GOP primary.
author: Matt Shuham
title: McConnell Sidesteps Trump’s Endorsement Of Celebrity Doctor Oz Weeks Before GOP Primary

author: Nick Arama
title: McConnell Flattens the Dems: They're Heading for a 'Pretty Good Beating' in Midterms

sentence: Trump’s standing has improved in North Carolina, where he has endorsed Rep. Ted Budd for the state’s open Senate seat, and in Pennsylvania, where he endorsed former television host Dr. Mehmet Oz for Senate over the weekend as “the one most able to win the General Election against a Radical Left Democrat looking to do unthinkable harm to our Country.” In Ohio, where Trump has also not weighed in on Republican Gov.
author: Eli Yokley
title: Trump’s Endorsees May Lose Some Primaries, but He’s Still the GOP’s Dominant Force

sentence: — Minority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-Ky.) "The Great Commonwealth of Pennsylvania has a tremendous opportunity to Save America by electing the brilliant and well-known Dr. Mehmet Oz for the United States Senate.
title: Donald Trump endorsed Dr. Mehmet Oz over the weekend in the Pennsylvania Senate race. Mitch McConnell didn't follow suit.

sentence: Trump has endorsed Herschel Walker in his race to unseat Sen. Raphael Warnock, D-Ga., Rep. Ted Budd in his campaign to replace retiring Sen. Richard Burr, R-N.C., and Dr. Mehmet Oz in his close primary race to replace retiring Sen. Pat Toomey, R-Pa. Trump has not yet endorsed a Senate candidate in Ohio, although multiple Republicans seek his support.
author: Timothy Frudd
title: Trump’s approval rating remains strong among Republicans

sentence: Donald Trump’s recent endorsement of Dr. Mehmet Oz in the Pennsylvania Republican Senate primary shook MAGA world to its core.
author: Rick Moran
title: The Silly Talk of Trump's Demise Over Oz Endorsement

sentence: On Saturday night, Trump outraged Pennsylvania conservatives by endorsing TV personality Dr. Mehmet Oz, a more moderate Republican candidate for the state's open Senate seat.
author: Madz Dizon
title: Mitch McConnell Warns GOP Could Screw Up Senate Takeover in Midterm Election with "Unacceptable Candidates"

sentence: In Pennsylvania, for example, he endorsed Dr. Mehmet Oz who, like Trump, was a longtime TV personality before entering politics.
title: Mitch McConnell openly attacks Trump
